description.message: A chrome extension that notifies your desktop of github web notifications.

preparation_li_1.message: Log in to github with this browser.

preparation_li_2.message: Select notification settings from the settings page and turn on notifications to the web.

preparation_li_3.message: Please allow the notification settings of this browser in the settings of the computer.

steps_li_2.message: Click the icon on the toolbar and click 'START' from the popup.

steps_li_3.message: Automatically check the notification page while this page is open. (Run every minute) *If you pin it to a tab and keep it small, it will not get in the way.

steps_li_4.message: If there is a new notification, give a desktop notification.

steps_li_5.message: Click on a desktop notification to open the notification page on GitHub.

remarks_li_1.message: Fetching to notification page in the background.

remarks_li_1_li_1.message: You don't need to have the GitHub notification page open in your browser.

remarks_li_1_li_2.message: If you don't have a tab that has a notification page open, clicking on a desktop notification will open the page in a new tab.

remarks_li_1_li_3.message: If you have a tab that has a notification page open, click on desktop notification to activate that tab.

remarks_li_2.message: The process ends when this page is closed.

remarks_li_3.message: You can see the processing log in the developer mode console. (press F12)

notes_li_1.message: Notifications may not work if the GitHub notification page is redesigned. (I will fix it as soon as I notice it)
